Topic.Title: Patent war: VirnetX (VHC) from 1 to 41+ and can Vringo ( VRNG) does the same thing?!!!

Message.Msg: This message is compiled for VRNG's legal team to check and see what did happen to ON2, by a small group of BILLIONAIREs, might happen to VRNG shareholders should they not be on the shareholders side but on the other side: Take a Look at Vringo's Continued Strength as These Whales Remain in the Stock James Hunter July 24, 2012 Notable investors like [...] billionaire owner of the Dallas Mavericks Mark Cuban are still holding shares of Vringo. On April 2, Mark Cuban filed a 13G, disclosing a 7.4 percent ownership of Vringo, amounting to just over 1 million shares. ---------- Google takes over ON2 and Motorola at some point, here are those directly or indirectly INVOLVED in the "stealth" process to make those transactions to happen: May 2007: ON2 & Hantro deal and Rumor related to Adobe; Hambrecht, T. Armstrong, M. Message.Title: Back to 570ish
Message.Msg: Here we go right back to 570ish. If we close anywhere either lower than open or on the open, were headed lower. Should see the major selling happening options expiration week. Good luck all. Ill be buying after this OE.

Topic.Title: MSFT to Buy VRNG Patents and Ruin Google?

Message.Msg: Google is foolish for not acquiring vrng. If msft buys out vrng then bing can become the dominant search engine. Msft would not have to license the ip/patents to google if they didn't want to. All of googles pay per click ads and free algorithmic search results totally rely on vrng patents to sort results
The Apple-Google brawl extends far beyond the courts, with both companies racing to develop new features, digital-content offerings—including books and music—and services like maps.
